intro: Euphrasia scabra var. caudata, commonly known as the hairy eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Euphrasia scabra var. caudata is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
